Who I Am

A Fourth year computer science major at The University of Chicago. Originally from the Bay Area. My passions are technology, programming, design, music, crossfit, mma and surfing in no particular order. My dream is to make a career out of any combination of these. If you think you have a job or task I might be right for, or you just want to chat, please feel free to contact me.

Projects

Beats By Andrey

An expirement on the randomness of lyrics. One part web crawler one part markov chain text generator. Built with Django, hosted on Heroku

Surfscrape

A web application that allows users to sign up for free text message updates on surf conditions at their favorite surf spots. Built on a Flask framework, hosted on Heroku

PeerProof

An web portal for students to anonymously exchange academic papers for prood reading. Built on Rails, hosted on Heroku

XFit Utility

An iOS app that includes an interval timer in addition to a max weight percentage calculator and graphing of max weight progression over time

iSaver

A simple script to be run as a chron job that dims the a users display for 30 seconds every 20 minutes to remind the user to take a break from staring at the screen.

shopkins.xyz

My personal website. You're looking at it right now! It is admitedly redundant, but I really needed a sixth project to even out the grid

Work Experience

Belvedere Trading

Software Engineer Intern
  • Built cutting edge infrastructure for trading and market communication. Was able to reduce latency through baseline testing and refactoring to previously unreached levels.
  • Architected a web based GUI for visualizing and resolving connections during critical periods before market open.

Lumii Health

Web Developer Intern

Tempesta Media

Web Developer Intern

Technical Skills

Programming fundementals are immutable, whereas applications of programming languages change daily. Instead of an arbitrary self assesment of language "proficiency" I have choosen to display a more meaningful metric. Namely, what languages I use when I program and with what frequency.
